headline: Enforcement and Removal Assistant (OA) at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: United States Army Veteran leveraging over ten years DoD and civilian experience in customer service and data entry fields. My passion is acquire expertise in Information Technology (IT) Project Management and beyond, through a strong entry level foundation.

defaultPosition.description: Research detainee history using multiple sources to establish identity/citizenship and manage detained and non-detained dockets. Provide administrative support to managers, supervisors or staff members by assisting in the day-to-day management of office activities. Summarize and tabulate detainee information from various reports, utilizing a variety of databases and automated systems. Generate and verify detainee reports, encounters, charging documents, studies, data quality and create and revise spreadsheets, charts, graphs, and presentations. Exercise quality control over bond paperwork.
defaultPosition.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant (OA)

positions.description: Research detainee history using multiple sources to establish identity/citizenship and manage detained and non-detained dockets. Provide administrative support to managers, supervisors or staff members by assisting in the day-to-day management of office activities. Summarize and tabulate detainee information from various reports, utilizing a variety of databases and automated systems. Generate and verify detainee reports, encounters, charging documents, studies, data quality and create and revise spreadsheets, charts, graphs, and presentations. Exercise quality control over bond paperwork.
positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant (OA)

positions.description: Authenticate federal, state and local forms of identification to establish personal identity. Verify fingerprint adjudication and background initiation dates are current. Perform registrar, printer and issuance functions to produce the Personal Identity Verification (PIV) card in accordance with Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12 (HSPD-12). Serve as point of contact for Human Resource related issues involving trouble shooting background checks, selecting logical access, or sponsoring applicants. Generate statistical data to create best practices. Manage office activities within the PIV Police Service.
positions.title: Security Assistant (OA)

positions.description: Implement and maintain emergency management and physical security safeguards. Grant, deny and control access to residences utilizing CCTV monitors and ensure physical security policies, standards and procedures are in place. Provide intermittent assistance with staff scheduling, employee orientation and time keeping activities. Educate new employees in company policies, best practices and assist in coordinating and monitoring staff training. Advise management on vague or technical issues; enforce general house rules and provide above level public relations skills to guests, media and the general public.
positions.location: 1120 N. Lale Shore Dr. Chicago IL 60611
positions.title: Customer Service Representative
